Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Grievance procedures
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4132
Section (2) The procedure shall provide for all of the following:
Description (c)Delineating the method of initiating the procedure.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility has a policy regarding the investigation of allegations
of a sexual nature and this was not followed after a youth alleged
another youth touched him inappropriately.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 04/05/2024 and
reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed during a face-to-face visit at the facility
on 04/05/2024. He stated he had filed a grievance previously (he
could not specifically remember when) because Youth B had
made suggestive comments to him that made him uncomfortable,
and Youth A did not know if the intentions of Youth B were
dangerous or sexual. Youth A stated Therapist and Operations
Manager had spoken with him shortly after he filed this grievance.
Youth A was not sure if his bedroom was changed as a result of
this conversation. He did recall the conversation with those two
staff seemed to end the matter and things had been better since
that time.
The Therapist was interviewed during a face-to-face visit at the
facility on 05/06/2024. She recalled the time when Youth A had
filed a grievance and she responded to it. She stated she had
spoken with Youth A on 11/30/2023 after the grievance had been
filed on 11/25/2023. She believed the grievance made its way to
her on 11/29/2023. The Therapist recalled Youth A wanting a
room change to across the unit away from Youth B, and this was
something that was able to be accommodated and implemented.
The Therapist stated she did not perform a PREA investigation as
a result of what was presented to her. At that time, she believed
the only trained PREA investigator on staff was the Operations
Manager, but others have since been trained.
The Operations Manager was interviewed during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on 05/24/2024. He
stated that he did not perform a PREA investigation for this
2

original incident in November 2023 because it did not meet the
requirements for doing so, namely that this was not a repeated
instance of accused sexual harassment at that point in time. The
Operations Manager confirmed that he was not on campus when
this accusation was made by Youth A, and he knew the issue was
addressed by other staff. The Operations Manager also recalled
he was the only trained PREA investigator for the facility at that
time, but since then two additional staff have been trained with
one more almost finished with the training.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed during a face-to-face
visit at the facility on 05/06/2024. Documentation was provided
regarding the previous grievance and facility policy. The Chief
Administrator confirmed that a PREA investigation was not
performed at the time of the initial grievance because they did not
believe it was warranted due to the behavior being verbal only and
not a repeated situation at that time.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility policies & procedures were provided and reviewed.
o The facility Grievance policy stated staff will respond
to a written and submitted grievance request within
two working days of receiving a grievance. The
youth or family member that filed the grievance will
receive a written response within five days of
receiving the grievance.
o The facility Freedom from Sexual
Harassment/Abuse policy stated there is a zero
tolerance policy of the sexual assault/rape of clients
within the program. It also defined resident-on-
resident sexual harassment as repeated and
unwelcome sexual advances.
• Documentation of the grievance filed by Youth A was
provided and reviewed.
o The grievance written by Youth A was dated
11/25/2023. In it Youth A stated Youth B had been
making him feel uncomfortable, and Youth B told
Youth A he was bisexual and he made inappropriate
comments and touched Youth A in some form
(although what this touching consisted of was never
specified).
o Documentation of the response to Youth A from the
Therapist was dated 11/30/2023. The Therapist
stated Youth A told her this stemmed from one
instance that occurred on 11/06/2023, where Youth
B made comments to Youth A and other youth that
3

he was bisexual. Youth A stated that same day
Youth B came up behind Youth A and hugged him
from behind and made inappropriate sexual
comments toward Youth A and others. Youth A
requested a room change as a result of the concern
and the Therapist documented that this was able to
occur.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as there was evidence
found the facility did not act on a provided grievance in a timely
manner, specifically not meeting the two day requirement set out
in facility policy.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Based on the findings in this report a CAP is required.
Per SIR #2024C000983SI, a 1st provisional license is recommended.
